questions.question: What does 'GI' represent in the GI/M/1 queueing system?

explanations.a: Incorrect. 'GI' does not represent Gaussian distribution for arrivals.
explanations.b: Correct. 'GI' stands for general inter-arrival time distribution in the GI/M/1 queueing system.
explanations.c: Incorrect. 'GI' does not represent geometric distribution for arrivals.
explanations.d: Incorrect. 'GI' does not represent global service rate distribution.

questions.question: How does the utilization factor 'ρ' affect the performance of a GI/M/1 queue?

answers.a: Higher ρ leads to lower average waiting times.
answers.b: Lower ρ leads to higher system stability.
answers.c: ρ does not affect the performance of the system.
answers.d: Higher ρ leads to higher probabilities of queue overflow.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Higher utilization factor ('ρ') leads to higher average waiting times.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Lower utilization factor ('ρ') generally leads to higher system stability.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Utilization factor ('ρ') significantly affects the performance of the system.
explanations.d: Correct. Higher utilization factor ('ρ') leads to higher probabilities of queue overflow and poorer system performance.

questions.question: In a GI/M/1 queueing system, what distribution characterizes the service times?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Service times in a GI/M/1 queue are not typically characterized by a Gaussian distribution.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Poisson distribution is commonly associated with arrival processes, not service times.
explanations.c: Correct. The service times in a GI/M/1 queueing system follow an exponential distribution.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Uniform distribution is not typically used to model service times in queueing systems.

questions.question: What happens to the average waiting time in a GI/M/1 queue as the variability of inter-arrival times increases?

answers.d: It depends on the service rate.

explanations.a: Incorrect. The average waiting time typically increases as the variability of inter-arrival times increases.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The average waiting time is influenced by the variability of inter-arrival times.
explanations.c: Correct. The average waiting time increases as the variability of inter-arrival times increases in a GI/M/1 queueing system.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The average waiting time is primarily affected by the variability of inter-arrival times.
